comments.creator: jacob.benoit.1@gmail.com
comments.text:
Created attachment 512218
update .hgignore

this makes hg commands such as `hg status' and `hg addremove' useful again. Otherwise I have to scroll through lots of noise to find what I'm looking for.

Don't know whom to ask for review! CC'ing a few core people.
comments.author: jacob.benoit.1@gmail.com

this makes hg commands such as `hg status' and `hg addremove' useful again. Otherwise I have to scroll through lots of noise to find what I'm looking for.

comments.text:
Comment on attachment 512218
update .hgignore

I like it, and it's close enough to build stuff.

r=me.
comments.creator: khuey@kylehuey.com
comments.author: khuey@kylehuey.com
comments.raw_text:
I like it, and it's close enough to build stuff.

r=me.

You know, I actually think this is a bad idea. If you have lots of .rej and .orig files hanging around, you should just delete them. Adding this makes it a lot harder to do so, since you can't just "hg st -un | xargs rm".
comments.author: ted@mielczarek.org
comments.text: You know, I actually think this is a bad idea. If you have lots of .rej and .orig files hanging around, you should just delete them. Adding this makes it a lot harder to do so, since you can't just "hg st -un | xargs rm".

comments.raw_text: The accidental .orig file additions in bug 680246 would probably not have happened with this.
